title: 111_s304
content: The Main Street Recovery Act includes temporary reinstatement of the regular investment tax credit for property placed in service after 2008 and before July 1, 2010, with a regular percentage of 15 percent. Additionally, it involves a temporary extension and modification of special allowance for certain property. The Main Street Recovery Act temporarily extends the regular investment tax credit until July 1, 2011, and modifies certain dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Main Street Recovery Act extends the investment tax credit until July 1, 2011, and makes changes to dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by substituting specific dates. The Main Street Recovery Act extends the investment tax credit until July 1, 2011, and amends dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by changing specific dates. Amendments include expanding certain real property categories. The amendments made by the Main Street Recovery Act extend the investment tax credit until July 1, 2011 and amend dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2008, with some exceptions for specific provisions. SEC. 4 of the Main Street Recovery Act temporarily increases limitations on and modifies the expensing of certain depreciable business assets for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008. The changes include extending expensing to all tangible depreciable property and apply to 2008, 2009, and 2010.
